subject: Clone volume with right size with SolidFire
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-31 02:15:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': 'Clone volume with right size with SolidFire

It is possible to clone a volume with a size greater than
the source volume. When using the SolidFire driver, the volume size
was not passed in the call made to the SolidFire API when
cloning a volume.

It resulted in a cloned volume having the same size as the source
volume but the correct size in the Cinder database.

This changes makes sure the cloned volume has the correct size
by explicitly passing the requested size when calling
the SolidFire API and cloning the volume.

Fixes: bug #1219105
Change-Id: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clone volume with right size with SolidFire

It is possible to clone a volume with a size greater than
the source volume. When using the SolidFire driver, the volume size
was not passed in the call made to the SolidFire API when
cloning a volume.

It resulted in a cloned volume having the same size as the source
volume but the correct size in the Cinder database.

This changes makes sure the cloned volume has the correct size
by explicitly passing the requested size when calling
the SolidFire API and cloning the volume.

Fixes: bug #1219105
Change-Id: I5628c7fa922780d6b0601e2daa79310a61085edc

commit_message: Interprete scoped key as nested tags Current codes in xml_util.py does not support REST xml so well when one tagname contains delimiter, it fails to be interpreted. So this patch is to interprete one tagname like "12" as a nested tag like "12". Fix bug:1205983 Change-Id: Ia56ba0da7a840d120298d467d077e6c4eec6f74b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 00:00:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix 500 error on invalid security-group-rule creation for NVP

Validate that, when creating rules specifying a protocol different
from TCP, UDP, ICMP and ICMPv6, no port (range) is specified because
NVP does not like it.

The extra validation is specific to the NVP plugin because other
plugins may choose a different failure mode. For example, the ovs
plugin does not complain at all, but it just ignores the port range
if the protocol is not a port-oriented one.

Change-Id: I46e9032b5cf7f7d88b9d05c3bf020784b04217d9
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-22 00:00:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_security_group.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/plugins/nicira/NeutronPlugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/nicira/test_nicira_plugin.py'], 'message': 'Fix 500 error on invalid security-group-rule creation for NVP

from TCP, UDP, ICMP and ICMPv6, no port (range) is specified because
NVP does not like it.

The extra validation is specific to the NVP plugin because other

Fixes bug #1213293

Change-Id: I46e9032b5cf7f7d88b9d05c3bf020784b04217d9

commit_message:
Fix 500 error on invalid security-group-rule creation for NVP

Validate that, when creating rules specifying a protocol different
from TCP, UDP, ICMP and ICMPv6, no port (range) is specified because
NVP does not like it.

The extra validation is specific to the NVP plugin because other
plugins may choose a different failure mode. For example, the ovs
plugin does not complain at all, but it just ignores the port range
if the protocol is not a port-oriented one.

Fixes bug #1213293

Change-Id: I46e9032b5cf7f7d88b9d05c3bf020784b04217d9

subject: Add venv wrapper for check_uptodate.sh
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-31 11:42:49.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh'], 'message': 'Add venv wrapper for check_uptodate.sh

tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh is added in run_tests.sh

For simple, run "run_tests.sh -p" will call it, and get following error:

Failed to collect options from module
cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_3par_common: No module named hp3parclient

Actually, the hp3parclient is listed in test-requirements.txt, and it is
installed in venv.

the check_uptodate.sh should run in venv to get correct result.

update the error message to update the cindier.conf.sample correctly.

-----------
Test method
-----------
$ pwd
/opt/stack/cinder

$ source .venv/bin/activate; tools/conf/generate_sample.sh

(.venv)$ deactivate

$ ./run_tests.sh  -p
Running flake8 ...
// no error emitted here

Fixes Bug #1219197

Change-Id: I9b3eaf3c1a5eb395eefed28bb907685cdef147aa
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add venv wrapper for check_uptodate.sh

tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh is added in run_tests.sh

For simple, run "run_tests.sh -p" will call it, and get following error:

Failed to collect options from module
cinder.volume.drivers.san.hp.hp_3par_common: No module named hp3parclient

Actually, the hp3parclient is listed in test-requirements.txt, and it is
installed in venv.

the check_uptodate.sh should run in venv to get correct result.

update the error message to update the cindier.conf.sample correctly.

-----------
Test method
-----------
$ pwd
/opt/stack/cinder

$ source .venv/bin/activate; tools/conf/generate_sample.sh

(.venv)$ deactivate

$ ./run_tests.sh  -p
Running flake8 ...
// no error emitted here

Fixes Bug #1219197

Change-Id: I9b3eaf3c1a5eb395eefed28bb907685cdef147aa

commit_message:
Handle Centos/RHEL pymongo packages

RHEL/Centos has a different name for pymongo packages.  Fedora doesn't
provide python-sqlite2 so we undef that.

Fixes bug 1194141

Change-Id: If03f420c41e518227a1422882842661dfc8edd7e

commit_message:
Return 400 if creating a distributed router on old NVP platforms

Without checking for the right NVP support, creating a distributed
router will silently fail, i.e. ithe 'distributed' attribute will
be ignored and a centralized router will be created instead.

Supports blueprint nvp-distributed-router

Change-Id: If8e40c0907d78c30f9ba918aaaff57e58ebb8055

commit_message:
bp: pxeboot-port, provide pxeboot on ports

Teach neutron how to manage PXE boot.

Allow pxe boot parameters to be specified when creating a network port.

Implements bp:pxeboot-ports

Change-Id: I45fe7a16bc6c5975a765dd6a065558b9ba702e5b

commit_message:
add require grant allow

Some httpd servers are set up so that the root directory defaults
to denying privileges causing horizon to fail.  This change adds
a command to allow overrides in the horizon directory,

Change-Id: I51da03624582a85bff812acaa21aebdd437d9baa

commit_message:

commit_message:
NetApp storage service feature support

This change introduces storage service feature for
NetApp drivers. It reports back supported service
features like mirroring, deduplication, compression
etc. to the scheduler which can be used to shortlist
backends. It accepts extra_specs defined
in volume type with the service features and provisions
volumes based on the requested spec.

blueprint cinder-nfs-driver-qos

Change-Id: I0706af2fe39b2db111a6d98b016307fc63f74dc6

for adding dhcp checksums so that dhcp will work with older clients.

commit_message:
Remove multi_host check for dhcp checksum

This removes the conditional check that actives the workaround
for adding dhcp checksums so that dhcp will work with older clients.
This check is necessary for single host configurations as well as
multi host once as some single code configurations (such as devstack)
will have multiple VM's on one machine with a local dhcp server.

This workaround will save a lot of headache with devstack since without
devstack may mysteriously refuse to work because of dhcp problems.

Change-Id: Iaf03c08b9456a764646eec0efffdb31829502de2

When creating a flavor in the parent cell it isnt
created in the child cells. At the moment flavors
need to be created individually in all cells.

  specific cell
* Add related tests

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2835, 'name': 'Brian Elliott', 'email': 'bdelliott@gmail.com', 'username': 'belliott'}, {'_account_id': 5044, 'name': 'Mate Lakat', 'email': 'mlakat@suse.com', 'username': 'mate-lakat'}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-31 17:40:14.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/xenapi/test_vmops.py'], 'message': 'xenapi: Create a ghost when deleting an instance

The XenAPI has to scrub the memory used by an instance after deleting
it.  This imposes a delay--variable on the size of the instance and
the speed of the hypervisor host--before that memory can be reused.
To account for the memory being unavailable, this change causes the
virt driver to return a Ghost when an instance is destroyed.  The
expiration time is computed using a simple linear equation, with the
size of the instance memory, in megabytes, being the variable.  The
constants of this equation are set through the configuration options
xenapi_ghost_constant and xenapi_ghost_multiplier, and the expiration
time for the ghost is computed as:

    expire = xenapi_ghost_constant + memory_mb * xenapi_ghost_multiplier

where "memory_mb" is the size of the instance's memory allocation in
megabytes.  The defaults for the configuration options are chosen to
compute one second per gigabyte plus a constant half-second overhead.
As the ghost mechanism is a best-effort mechanism, these defaults
should be sufficient, but they are made configurable for tuning.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I82f5d68f34677869cb76fbf08445acbb6f37e592
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Create a ghost when deleting an instance

The XenAPI has to scrub the memory used by an instance after deleting
it.  This imposes a delay--variable on the size of the instance and
the speed of the hypervisor host--before that memory can be reused.
To account for the memory being unavailable, this change causes the
virt driver to return a Ghost when an instance is destroyed.  The
expiration time is computed using a simple linear equation, with the
size of the instance memory, in megabytes, being the variable.  The
constants of this equation are set through the configuration options
xenapi_ghost_constant and xenapi_ghost_multiplier, and the expiration
time for the ghost is computed as:

    expire = xenapi_ghost_constant + memory_mb * xenapi_ghost_multiplier

where "memory_mb" is the size of the instance's memory allocation in
megabytes.  The defaults for the configuration options are chosen to
compute one second per gigabyte plus a constant half-second overhead.
As the ghost mechanism is a best-effort mechanism, these defaults
should be sufficient, but they are made configurable for tuning.

DocImpact

Implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I82f5d68f34677869cb76fbf08445acbb6f37e592

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-29 21:43:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add tracking of instance ghosts

With some virt drivers, deletion of an instance does not immediately
release the resources formerly used by that instance; the virt layer
instead must perform some scrubbing for security purposes, which
may take some time.  This change adds the concept of a "ghost" to
nova-compute: a "ghost" is an object which holds the resources
formerly held by the deleted instance until a given expiration time.
A ghost may be returned by the virt driver's destroy() method, in
place of the default None return value.

Ghosts are not persisted to the database; they represent a best-
effort mechanism to prevent scheduling an instance to a host which
may not yet have made the vacated resources available.  Should a
ghost be lost, and a compute node fail to create an instance as a
consequence, the normal rescheduling mechanism should suffice to
ensure the instance is created.

Partially implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I1f9d8e1bfa47a4aab99cfe76567779e841c37a8f

ensure the instance is created.

Partially implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I1f9d8e1bfa47a4aab99cfe76567779e841c37a8f
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Add tracking of instance ghosts

With some virt drivers, deletion of an instance does not immediately
release the resources formerly used by that instance; the virt layer
instead must perform some scrubbing for security purposes, which
may take some time.  This change adds the concept of a "ghost" to
nova-compute: a "ghost" is an object which holds the resources
formerly held by the deleted instance until a given expiration time.
A ghost may be returned by the virt driver's destroy() method, in
place of the default None return value.

Ghosts are not persisted to the database; they represent a best-
effort mechanism to prevent scheduling an instance to a host which
may not yet have made the vacated resources available.  Should a
ghost be lost, and a compute node fail to create an instance as a
consequence, the normal rescheduling mechanism should suffice to
ensure the instance is created.

Partially implements blueprint ghosts.

Change-Id: I1f9d8e1bfa47a4aab99cfe76567779e841c37a8f

This Change adds test cases for vlan in OpenVSwitch

This change adds test cases for vlan networking
to OpenVSwitch support in OpenStack Neutron Module.
It uses Mock Python Library.

commit_message:
Added native ipmi driver

Implemented a power driver for baremetal node that uses the a native
python ipmi driver called pyghmi. Due to the name conflict, ipmi.py
has been changed to ipmitool.py.

Implements: blueprint native-ipmi
Change-Id: I2b9f32876ba01d9d08ba1fc34d5340b14da7c997

commit_message:
Call the set_hostname method on Agent during spawn

Call set_hostname method on Agent if agent supports
this feature. This is required for PV tools 6.1 where
rename feature has been removed.

Fixes: bug #1182934
Change-Id: I8563ecc656f1c5819688f550845f263dd8a93bf9

commit_message:
Move comment back to right place

The comment about skipping schedule for create volume from snapshot
in cast_create_volume() was mis-placed when this code was ported to
taskflow.  This patch moves the comment back to where it belongs.

Change-Id: I329c78a05143bf8589d9665dc4ff03fa80da6ec9

commit_message:
Use testtools as base test class.

Minor tests refactoring due to use testtools:
 - added missed setUp() and tearDown() to call these functions in
   base test case.
 - removed some superfluous tearDown() calls.
 - moved test_crud_inherited_role_grants_failed_if_disabled() method
   to separate class.

Fixes for python 2.6 enviroment:
 - replaced `with self.assertRaises(Exception): foo()` to
   `self.assertRaises(Exception, foo)
 - added to safe_repr(), assertDictEqual() and assertRaisesRegexp() methods
   to TestCase() class in keystone/test.py

Fixes bug 1179009

Change-Id: Iea67ad10d02db82fc8ed79b1096ddb5233925bfd

commit_message:
Clarify sql string when not using nova-conductor

You do not have to use nova-conductor and can
instead use direct DB connections from the compute
nodes. This change makes a note and clarifies the
nova.conf changes which are required if you wish to
do so.

Change-Id: I60baf1b235172ef4ea8152b0119543d17e07cd42

commit_message:
Add support for FC zone lifecycle management

Allows automated zone lifecycle management in the attach/detach
entry points of the volume manager for FC volumes (when fabric
zoning is enabled). Zones are configured automatically as part
of the active zone set in the FC SAN to provide a more flexible
and secure way of controlling access. FC zone manager enables
SAN vendors to add support for pluggable implementations.

TODO: Base PWWN lookup support, common code refactoring, SSH
connection pool review comments, exception/error handling
review comments

Change-Id: I0a9ef5b8e785c53fe4b35cf997f45feb89840c8c
Implements: blueprint cinder-fc-zone-manager

commit_message:
Remove testcase test_invalid_auth_version_request

In keystoneclient/middleware/auth_token.py, _choose_api_version(), the
codes's logic assume that auth_version in conf is always correct, so the
testcase test_invalid_auth_version_request() is incorrect. This patch
remove it.

Fixes bug #1218881

Change-Id: I6aec0526a6a60eea8d357ec1b44570e7d74da653

commit_message:
Remove keep_data_fp argument from DiskFile constructor

All access to the data_file fp for DiskFile is moved under the new "open"
method.  This reduces the surface area of the DiskFile abstraction and reduces
the exposure of the underlying implementation in the object-server.

Future work:

 * Add public "create" method to DiskFile to wrap DiskWriter
 * Add public "delete" method to DiskFile
 * Consolidate put_metadata to DiskWriter
 * Add public "update_metdata" method to DiskFile
 * Move all access of .metadata property in object-server under "open"
 * Create DiskReader class to gather all access of methods under "open"

Change-Id: I932ab3669e4cd1a48555cdadbeb984ba6c8efb1a

commit_message:
Create RPC connection before modifying OVS bridges

On startup, the agent removes and readds flows to the OVS bridges.  If
an RPC setup error exits the process prematurely, this can leave the
bridges in an unsafe state.  It is better to set the RPC communication
up before making changes to the host system.

Closes-Bug: 1217980
Change-Id: Ib9bbb864b9129bb7b1376a150a37a0c07908d74b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Gran <stephen.gran@guardian.co.uk>

commit_message:
Implement decorator-based notifications for users

Refactors the keystone.notifications module to use decorators, and
applies those new decorators to user CRUD operations at the manager
layer.

blueprint notifications

Change-Id: Ic7937657196a0ad19923153a5135b1451a533e81

commit_message:
Add PCI device tracker to compute resource tracker

PCI device tracker manages all the PCI devices life cycle.

The resource tracker on a compute node uses the PCI device tracker's
interface to query for resources, claim PCI devices, and alloc and
free PCI devices for instances.

bp:pci-passthrough-base

Change-Id: I766d7f92e26fb75c1d6095dc0237c44f938d4170
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Adds Instance UUID to rsync debug logging

This commit adds the instance uuid to the rsync debug output in
the debug logs. The issue we were seeing is that when multiple
migrations are ongoing at the same time, it's not easy to
track the rsync progress of each migration.
Fixes: bug #1215629

Change-Id: Iec662bdc0aed1c6f54ecaa062335dc5504ac030f

commit_message:
Allow users to extract tars to containers with ACLs set

This fixes bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/swift/+bug/1203182 (well
it should :) I don't have keystone installed but the same issue
existed with tempauth).

Change-Id: I6f4045f484b27c0153a9244e0dbf2641cbc9e84e

subject: Avoid swallowing exceptions in network manager
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-25 10:19:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid swallowing exceptions in _allocate_fixed_ips()

In _allocate_fixed_ips(), we spawn off green threads to call
_rpc_allocate_fixed_ip() on remote network managers, but if there is an
exception in the thread it just gets swallowed.

We don't really need a GreenPool here. It's not like its limit of 1000
threads is relevant here. Just use eventlet.spawn(), collect the list of
threads spawned and call wait() on each of them. This will ensure the
exception gets raised by wait().

Also, fix a case in the v3 integrated servers test where we are setting
up fake networks which are associated with a non-existent 'fake-mini'
host. See also I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d.

Change-Id: I7af1c4c1869edf3601809fe02fb82b12c8b70811
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-25 10:34:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid swallowing exceptions in network manager

In _allocate_fixed_ips() and setup_networks_on_host(), we spawn off
green threads to call _rpc_allocate_fixed_ip() and
rpc_setup_network_on_host() on remote network managers, but if there is
an exception in the thread it just gets swallowed.

We don't really need a GreenPool here. It's not like its limit of 1000
threads is relevant here. Just use eventlet.spawn(), collect the list of
threads spawned and call wait() on each of them. This will ensure the
exception gets raised by wait().

Also, fix a case in the v3 integrated servers test where we are setting
up fake networks which are associated with a non-existent 'fake-mini'
host. See also I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d.

Change-Id: I7af1c4c1869edf3601809fe02fb82b12c8b70811
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-08-27 21:58:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Avoid swallowing exceptions in network manager

In _allocate_fixed_ips() and setup_networks_on_host(), we spawn off
green threads to call _rpc_allocate_fixed_ip() and
rpc_setup_network_on_host() on remote network managers, but if there is
an exception in the thread it just gets swallowed.

We don't really need a GreenPool here. It's not like its limit of 1000
threads is relevant here. Just use eventlet.spawn(), collect the list of
threads spawned and call wait() on each of them. This will ensure the
exception gets raised by wait().

Also, fix a case in the v3 integrated servers test where we are setting
up fake networks which are associated with a non-existent 'fake-mini'
host. See also I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d.

threads spawned and call wait() on each of them. This will ensure the
exception gets raised by wait().

Also, fix a case in the v3 integrated servers test where we are setting
up fake networks which are associated with a non-existent 'fake-mini'
host. See also I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d.

commit_message:
Avoid swallowing exceptions in network manager

In _allocate_fixed_ips() and setup_networks_on_host(), we spawn off
green threads to call _rpc_allocate_fixed_ip() and
rpc_setup_network_on_host() on remote network managers, but if there is
an exception in the thread it just gets swallowed.

We don't really need a GreenPool here. It's not like its limit of 1000
threads is relevant here. Just use eventlet.spawn(), collect the list of
threads spawned and call wait() on each of them. This will ensure the
exception gets raised by wait().

Also, fix a case in the v3 integrated servers test where we are setting
up fake networks which are associated with a non-existent 'fake-mini'
host. See also I9854863bbec8834c638c55832411f63da570f82d.

blueprint: oslo-messaging
Change-Id: I7af1c4c1869edf3601809fe02fb82b12c8b70811

These both apply to the proxy servers:

First, instead of consturction a dict just to use with `.update()` simply set a
set of keys in the headers dict.

Second, generating the headers for proxy requests once, no matter how many
backend servers are accessed (instead of once per backend server), they all get
the same headers.

Change-Id: Ib42bf7750e175a6ad9b777fa35655380feeafb93
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Two small performance improvements to header generation

These both apply to the proxy servers:

First, instead of consturction a dict just to use with `.update()` simply set a
set of keys in the headers dict.

Second, generating the headers for proxy requests once, no matter how many
backend servers are accessed (instead of once per backend server), they all get
the same headers.

Change-Id: Ib42bf7750e175a6ad9b777fa35655380feeafb93

commit_message:
Add support for Docker as Nova hypervisor

* Add basic support for hypervisor plugins in lib/nova_plugins
* Add lib/nova_plugins/hypervisor-docker to use Docker as a Nova
  hypervisor.
* Add tools/install_docker.sh to install the Docker daemon and
  registry container, download base image and import
* Configure Nova to use docker plugin
* Add docker exercise and skip unsupported ones

Nova blueprint: new-hypervisor-docker

Change-Id: I9e7065b562dce2ce853def583ab1165886612227

commit_message:
Standardize base.py with novaclient

Main changes:
* deprecate api variable in favour of client
* add documentation
* use to_slug from oslo strutils
* remove Python 2.4 support
* other small fixes from novaclient

Change-Id: Ife54fd3207798ee03101a48bc1cda3b3f62cc5e4

commit_message:
Fixing potential NameErrors

Fixing a couple locations that could potentially raise NameErrors
instead of intended exceptions.  These were found by looking at
flake8 F821 (undefined name) errors.

Added in unit tests to verify NameErrors would not be raised.

Change-Id: I8619cb0be495b814335a5aea23daca025484d3c6

commit_message:
Allow admins to update default quotas

Add update default quotas form to edit the default quotas.

Move the editable default quotas tab to a new panel called
"Defaults".

Implements blueprint edit-default-quota

Change-Id: I6e3806226cd2f699f16b93c25e294bc67883738f

commit_message:
Add apiclient.exceptions hierarchy

The new apiclient.exceptions hierarchy is more comprehensive
and it covers almost all HTTP error status codes. These
exceptions can be used in novaclient, keystoneclient,
glanceclient, and other client projects thus providing a
single inteface.

Users can have benefit from OpenStack clients raising exceptions
of known classes while now every client has its own classes making
difficult to catch, e.g., NotFound for every client.

Change-Id: Ia7b25880e0ffca3526525a0f0e77c7e77c4f0076

commit_message:
Replace auth_token middleware tests with httpretty

Httpretty will work in exactly the same way regardless of whether we use
the httplib or requests library. Convert it so we can modify the
middleware and know that our tests are still correct.

In this process we also split the tests from having V3 tests override
V2 tests, to having a base test class and V2 and V3 seperate overrides.

Change-Id: I1bfcecc6ae47a6dd5e76d4ceb8b3941e6ad1089f

commit_message:
Object API commands using our REST API layer

* Add object-store API to ClientManager
* Add object-store client
* Add Object API library in openstackclient.object.v1.lib
* Add Object API {container,object} list commands
* Add library tests
* Add command tests

This should complete the Object v1 container and object list commands

Change-Id: Ib1770d45efa8871959826b85faafa1e0bcef0a03

commit_message:
Delete and launch devices on the topology view

This feature enables to delete and launch a instance or router on the network
topology view. So you can do basic actions on this view.
Also it enables to change view small or normal. You can see more networks and
devices in the small view.

implements bp editable-network-topology-view

fixes bug #1215683

Change-Id: Ie65d50d2a99f72696c8f10223f8430ad5f90b144

commit_message:
Make resource_tracker record host_ip

Now that the host_ip, for affinity_filters, is coming from the DB and
the host_ip is virt driver independent so make the resource_tracker add
it.

part of bp no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler

Change-Id: I498578191b0af97cb91ca0d81b7ad1eeaf8fd995

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 18:14:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add "Action in progress" error for multi-engine.

Raises an "Action in progress" error if an action is in progress when
another action is issued.  The engine confirms the "in progress" status
by sending an RPC to the engine doing the work.  If the stack's status
is "in progress", but no response is received, the other engine is
assumed to have died and the action will proceed as usual.

Blueprint multi-engine
Fixes bug #1211276

commit_message:
Add "Action in progress" error for multi-engine

Raises an "Action in progress" error if an action is in progress when
another action is issued.  The engine confirms the "in progress" status
by sending an RPC to the engine doing the work.  If the stack's status
is "in progress", but no response is received, the other engine is
assumed to have died and the action will proceed as usual.

Blueprint multiple-engines

Change-Id: I9f03a2281e5dea04e45fec61fbdb1120f0a32ef0

commit_message:
Cleanup sections about Multiple Compute Nodes

common/section_multiple-compute-nodes.xml was not used everywhere.
It was introduced with change I0a7fb144241be7acf7c9063e5290220b5d7b7192
that moved content to the Config Guide, thus include it from there.

openstack-install/configuring-multiple-compute-nodes.xml is a duplicate
of common/section_multiple-compute-nodes.xml which was unused as well
and thus removed.

Change-Id: I4d4158ad033d5dd97d17f4f7f3efd0be0ca6801d

subject: Implement caching for Tokens and Token Validation
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-21 22:10:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Implement caching for Tokens

Based upon the keystone caching (using dogpile.cache) implementation
token caching is implemented in this patchset.

This patchset inclues basic Token caching as the first implemntation
of this caching layer.  The following methods are cached:
    * token_api.get_token,
    * token_api.list_revoked_tokens
    * token_provider_api.validate_v3_token
    * token_provider_api.check_v3_token

Calls to token_api.delete_token and token_api.delete_tokens will
properly invalidate the cache for the tokens being acted upon, as
well as invalidating the cache for the revoked_tokens_list.

DocImpact

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2013-08-29 09:01:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Implement caching for Tokens and Token Validation

Based upon the keystone caching (using dogpile.cache) implementation
token caching is implemented in this patchset.

This patchset inclues basic Token caching as the first implemntation
of this caching layer.  The following methods are cached:
    * token_api.get_token,
    * token_api.list_revoked_tokens
    * token_provider_api.validate_v3_token
    * token_provider_api.check_v3_token
    * token_provider_api.check_v2_token
    * token_provider_api.validate_v2_token
    * token_provider_api.validate_token

Calls to token_api.delete_token and token_api.delete_tokens will
properly invalidate the cache for the tokens being acted upon, as
well as invalidating the cache for the revoked_tokens_list and the
validate/check token calls.

Token caching is configurable independantly of the revocation_list
caching.

Lifted expiration checks from the token drivers to the token manager.
This ensures that cached tokens will still raise TokenNotFound when
expired.

For cache consistency, all token_ids are transformed into the short
token hash at the provider and token_driver level. Some methods would
have access to the full ID (PKI Tokens), and some methods would not.
Cache invalidation is inconsistent without token_id normalization.

DocImpact

partial-blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls

validate/check token calls.

Token caching is configurable independantly of the revocation_list
caching.

Lifted expiration checks from the token drivers to the token manager.
This ensures that cached tokens will still raise TokenNotFound when
expired.

For cache consistency, all token_ids are transformed into the short
token hash at the provider and token_driver level. Some methods would
have access to the full ID (PKI Tokens), and some methods would not.
Cache invalidation is inconsistent without token_id normalization.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Implement caching for Tokens and Token Validation

Based upon the keystone caching (using dogpile.cache) implementation
token caching is implemented in this patchset.

This patchset inclues basic Token caching as the first implementation
of this caching layer.  The following methods are cached:
    * token_api.get_token,
    * token_api.list_revoked_tokens
    * token_provider_api.validate_v3_token
    * token_provider_api.check_v3_token
    * token_provider_api.check_v2_token
    * token_provider_api.validate_v2_token
    * token_provider_api.validate_token

Calls to token_api.delete_token and token_api.delete_tokens will
properly invalidate the cache for the tokens being acted upon, as
well as invalidating the cache for the revoked_tokens_list and the
validate/check token calls.

Token caching is configurable independantly of the revocation_list
caching.

Lifted expiration checks from the token drivers to the token manager.
This ensures that cached tokens will still raise TokenNotFound when
expired.

For cache consistency, all token_ids are transformed into the short
token hash at the provider and token_driver level. Some methods would
have access to the full ID (PKI Tokens), and some methods would not.
Cache invalidation is inconsistent without token_id normalization.

DocImpact

partial-blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls
Change-Id: Ifada0db0043fede504a091670ccc521196c2f19c

Keep the legacy method for the cases that user may use
an old version of heat.

commit_message:
Unimplemented suspend/resume should not change vm state

When the underlying virt driver does not implement the suspend/resume API
and raises a NotImplementedError, the compute manager will error out and
change the instance's vm_state to ERROR. With this change, the compute
manager will handle the NotImplementedError and keep the instance
vm_state as it was before the error.

Change-Id: I8150a898fee91bbe66f1502638baca8050e2dd6d
Fixes: bug #1203986

commit_message:
Fix the Domain Context for Users panel

Add display of Domain ID and Domain Name in the Create and Update
Users page to give user a hint where the User will be created.
For Keystone V2, the two fields will be hidden.

When the Domain Context is set, the User will be created in that
Domain Context. Otherwise, the User will be created in the Domain
of the logon user.

On users creation, the listing of available projects will be based
on the Domain where it will be created.

Fixes bug 1215697

Change-Id: I780d11289ab73804d0d26ad71a07ece6b2da74ad

commit_message:
Defer computation of available methods until needed.

In practice this data is almost only ever needed if we're throwing an
HTTPMethodNotAllowed error, so we can avoid computing on every single
request to the proxy server.

Change-Id: I2abafa3aeb63ca6974dfcf6f31c864c049681f37

commit_message:
Disable compute fanout to scheduler

Now that nothing is using publish_service_capabilities it can be
disabled, but not removed in order to not break compute rpcapi backwards
compatibility.

Part of bp no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler.

Change-Id: I80c49c46138fd6ee89cb08ffbbced72ada4de72e

commit_message:
Make image_props_filter use information from DB not RPC

Make image_props_filter directly use the data from host_state and not
the data from capabilities that is currently broadcast from the
scheduler over RPC, as this will be removed since it doesn't scale.

Once all capabilities usage in scheduler filters is
removed the capabilities RPC broadcast can be removed.

Part of bp no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler.

Change-Id: I5e6bcec517edbf606903c3e98f3c63f7ba370bcf

subject: Make compute_capabilities_filter use information from DB not RPC
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-27 17:32:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make compute_capabilities_filter use information from DB not RPC

Make compute_capabilities_filter directly use the data in host_state and
not the data capabilities data that is currently broadcast from the
schedulers over RPC, as this will be removed since it doesn't scale.

The filter name, compute_capabilities_filter, is kept the same to keep
backwards compatibility.

This is a second attempt at this patch the first one broke the ability
to filter an arbitrary key value pairs, this time that is supported via
host_state.stats, along with tests to confirm

Once all the capabilities usage in scheduler filters is removed, the
capabilities RPC broadcast can be removed.

Part of bp no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler.

commit_message:
Make compute_capabilities_filter use information from DB not RPC

Make compute_capabilities_filter directly use the data in host_state and
not the data capabilities data that is currently broadcast from the
schedulers over RPC, as this will be removed since it doesn't scale.

The filter name, compute_capabilities_filter, is kept the same to keep
backwards compatibility.

This is a second attempt at this patch the first one broke the ability
to filter an arbitrary key value pairs, this time that is supported via
host_state.stats, along with tests to confirm

Once all the capabilities usage in scheduler filters is removed, the
capabilities RPC broadcast can be removed.

Part of bp no-compute-fanout-to-scheduler.

Change-Id: I0b9b05a25a8c1841093913c4a2fb19b48aff2ae1

commit_message:
Added Hive configuration, new nodeprocess - hiveserver

* Configuration hive-site.xml for Derby DB
* Added hive-default.xml
* Creating hive warehouse dir in HDFS
* Plugin validation exceptions

Implements blueprint edp-vanilla-plugin-hive-pig

Change-Id: I68b4f1307b8ff565d60d26c415eed1f553b8d5eb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-06-07 19:26:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Bug 1178375

This is for the Qpid rpc implementation - impl_qpid.py

Major restructuring of the Qpid exchange topology to solve leaky
exchange issue.

This also gets away from creating exchanges for all sort of htings.

The emphasis now is on AMQP 1.0 type addressing. There is no need for lots
of exchanges.

This will also help simplify any federation that may be needed for federation.
The topology is now all under the amq.topic excahnge.

amq.topic/topic/sometopicHLQ.sometopicLLQ.etc.
amq.topic/direct/somedirectaddress
amq.topic/fanout/somefanoutname

Change-Id: I09b8317c0d8a298237beeb3105f2b90cb13933d8

', 'number': 4}, {'created': '2013-08-28 17:22:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Support a new qpid topology

There has been a bug open for a while pointing out that the way we
create fanout exchanges with qpid results in leaking exchanges since
qpid doesn't support auto-deleting exchanges.  This was somewhat
mitigated by change to use a single reply queue.  This meant we created
far fewer direct exchanges, but the problem persists anyway.

A Qpid expert, William Henry, originally proposed a change to address
this issue.  Unfortunately, it wasn't backwards compatible with existing
installations.  This patch takes the same approach, but makes it
optional and off by default.  This will allow a migration period.

As a really nice side effect, the Qpid experts have told us that this
change will also allow us to use Qpid broker federation to provide HA.

Closes-bug: #1178375
Co-authored-by: William Henry <whenry@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I09b8317c0d8a298237beeb3105f2b90cb13933d8

commit_message:
Support a new qpid topology

There has been a bug open for a while pointing out that the way we
create direct exchanges with qpid results in leaking exchanges since
qpid doesn't support auto-deleting exchanges.  This was somewhat
mitigated by change to use a single reply queue.  This meant we created
far fewer direct exchanges, but the problem persists anyway.

A Qpid expert, William Henry, originally proposed a change to address
this issue.  Unfortunately, it wasn't backwards compatible with existing
installations.  This patch takes the same approach, but makes it
optional and off by default.  This will allow a migration period.

As a really nice side effect, the Qpid experts have told us that this
change will also allow us to use Qpid broker federation to provide HA.

DocImpact
Closes-bug: #1178375
Co-authored-by: William Henry <whenry@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I09b8317c0d8a298237beeb3105f2b90cb13933d8

commit_message:
Introduces Basic Report and Model

Introduces the classes for basic reports and the base data model
class to hold data for the report.  A basic report is composed of
sections, each of which has a generator (which produces the model)
and a view (which converts the model into a given representation).
Models may have an associated view, as well, to allow for sub-models
to have specific views attached to them.  This is the first part
of the Guru Meditation Report Framework.

Change-Id: Ic3ad1fd595da8742b5e7d4349a23132fc560f292
Implements: bp guru-meditation-report

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
OAuth authorizing user should propose roles to delegate

Currently in the oauth1 extension the consumer specifies roles
instead of delegator. This is a design fault that should be fixed
by having the authorizing user provide a set of roles (ids)
during the authorize request token phase.

fixes bug: #1216408

Change-Id: I08e803c7e046d4a2436c08535e2344ee654de889

commit_message:
Fix empty metadata issue of instance

Based on current implement, some metadata can't be extracted by
pollster, such as architecture, reservation_id, ephemeral_gb, etc.
This patch will try to get those metadata if we can and remove
those metadata what can't be pulled by pollster.

Fixes bug 1202749

Change-Id: I1f08c4eaa1cfacb612097cd0e90629d682f8acc9

commit_message:
XenAPI: More operations with LVM-based SRs

Some operations require Files-based SRs (ext3/NFS) - such as resize
and VHD download.  However, if using 3-part images or RAW then most
operations can be successful with this simple fix.

Fixes bug 1162382

Change-Id: Ia3d1c64871d78ab1bf6e197edaeee170d2b5dea8

The failure to re-read the partition table also means that the exit code
is non-0.

commit_message:
XenAPI: make_partition fixes for Dom0

When running in dom0, the calls to parted fail to re-read the partition
table so we have to use kpartx to read it specifically.

The failure to re-read the partition table also means that the exit code
is non-0.

Implements blueprint xenserver-core

Change-Id: I56ca25874d6491b0ed70e5efd477254bfe47294d

Change-Id: I5550c397230f94740c63e6cab30ac35b3ae85297
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove localhost references from tests

Using localhost in dummy URLs is a bad idea, because if you get
your mocking slightly wrong, some tests try to connect to the
services running in your local test environment.

Change-Id: I5550c397230f94740c63e6cab30ac35b3ae85297

commit_message:
Fix and gate on H302 (import only modules)

H302 is already part of the OpenStack style guide, and we only had a few
violations.  This fixes and gates on H302, so there is one less thing
for a reviewer to worry about.

gettext import line is ignored using hacking 0.7's import_exceptions
option.

Reason for import only modules 'The namespace management convention is
simple. The source of each identifier is indicated in a consistent way;
x.Obj says that object Obj is defined in module x.'
http://google-styleguide.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/pyguide.html

Change-Id: I53e8039f1dd2ebf8ab5fcf5a561feb3ca3363107

commit_message:
Add Ironic database creation to boot-stack

This patch will add creation and db-sync of Ironic database if Ironic
environment is found. This will allow developers to include the Ironic
element in the under-cloud image and deploy it from the seed vm for
development work and integration testing.

Change-Id: I6504c2eddefded3b7751b451109ee3bbfc6101a9
Authored-by: Chris Krelle <nobodycam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
chore: Track the up-and-coming oslo.cache module

While we wait for oslo.cache to land, I'd like to maintain a
verbatim copy under marconi.common so that we can start using
it immediately.

When oslo.cache is approved upstream, this copy of the code
will go away and we will add cache to marconi's
openstack-commong.conf

Change-Id: I608a2891ca06caec47ce18eda4edacd07bec40e9

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5044, 'name': 'Mate Lakat', 'email': 'mlakat@suse.com', 'username': 'mate-lakat'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-16 15:01:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'XenAPI: Remove "default" SR location

This value must be read from the PBD as it may change for different
installations.

commit_message:
XenAPI: SR location should default to location stored in PBD

This value must be read from the PBD as it may change for different
installations.  The existing default is preserved as a fallback
for the cases where a PBD path is not set.

Implements blueprint xenserver-core

Change-Id: I055ebe8d7d79f238b0b9565277acac945bbe12e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-31 14:42:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'xenapi: agent not inject ssh-key if cloud-init

It is possible to have an image with both the xenapi agent and
cloud-init present. In this case, we should not attempt to inject and
ssh-key using the agent, as this will be handled by cloud-init.

Cloud-Init is assumed to be present when the image has the property
"cloud_init_installed"

DocImpact
Part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop

Change-Id: I416ade49663208769571fe0c9cf22c8fc1360244

It is possible to have an image with both the xenapi agent and
cloud-init present. In this case, we should not attempt to use the agent
to inject any ssh keys or files, as this will be done by cloud-init.

Cloud-Init is assumed to be present when the image has the property:
cloud_init_installed=true

DocImpact
Part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop

commit_message:
xenapi: agent not inject ssh-key if cloud-init

It is possible to have an image with both the xenapi agent and
cloud-init present, or an alternative agent that makes use of metadata
to configure a server.

To ensure the agent will not clash with the ssh key and file injection
of the agent, I have added image properties so we can disable these
agent operations on a per image basis.

The image properties this new code looks for are:
xenapi_skip_agent_inject_ssh=true
xenapi_skip_agent_inject_files_at_boot=true

DocImpact
Part of blueprint xenapi-guest-agent-cloud-init-interop
Change-Id: I416ade49663208769571fe0c9cf22c8fc1360244

commit_message:
Extend JobBinary REST api to allow retrieval of raw data

Return job binary data as raw bytes.  This addition will allow
JobOrigin objects to refer to job binaries stored in the
savanna database by URL without special cases.

Change-Id: Iaf1f8cd92aa4659e6b5995089bfc89104d1b5da5

commit_message:
Neutron support

Added configurations:
* use_neutron

If Neutron is enabled, management network id is
passed as a parameter, when instances are being
launched.

Instance's internal and management IPs are equal and
point to the first IP in a list of a specified
management network.

Model classes for Cluster and Cluster Template updated.

Implements blueprint add-neutron-support

commit_message:
Oozie + MySQL configuration

* oozie-site.xml MySQL configuration
* MySQL starts on oozie node group
* MySQL starts if MySQL is enabled by config
* Oozie DB schema creating in MySQL
* Applying multiple general configs
* Added test for general configs

Implements blueprint edp-oozie-for-vanilla-plugin

Change-Id: I77342be5523f8584a5c6ba0d9fa2794d2702d27d

commit_message:
Neutron support

Network dropdown added.

To enable support add
"SAVANNA_USE_NEUTRON = True" to local_setting.py

Partially implements blueprint add-neutron-support

Change-Id: I88c795ef6d35caf5fd1780acb3b7dbf1333337af

commit_message:
per test_method logging

Using the FakeLogger/LoggerFixture fixture in order to capture the
per test method logs.

The per test method log capturing visible in the console on error or
failure.

The normal logging is preserved and only the INFO level log is
captured.

Change-Id: Id42f79bd3bcaba9aba57f4c0b8a373f33b8cd6bd

commit_message:
Fix usage of classmethod in various places

The decorator @classmethod isn't always correctly used in the code base,
this patches fixes some places where it was not used correctly.

Change-Id: Ifd4113b693889de0becc37854f4c62faf2fdab11

powervm: make start_lpar timeout

method.

commit_message:
Fix bulk networks/ports/subnet creation

Request/Response for bulk networks/ports/subnets creation were missing
I have added xml and json request/response bodies for these.

Fixes LP bug #1213890

Change-Id: I14975996a686871df19a8d8e5746bfbebf91a97a

subject: powervm: revert driver to pass for plug_vifs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1849, 'name': 'Joe Gordon', 'email': 'joe.gordon0@gmail.com', 'username': 'jogo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7069, 'name': 'Joshua Hesketh', 'email': 'josh@nitrotech.org', 'username': 'jhesketh'}, {'_account_id': 7282, 'name': 'Qing Xin Meng', 'email': 'mengqxqx@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'mengqxqx'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-27 21:46:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/powervm/test_powervm.py'], 'message': "powervm: revert driver to pass for plug_vifs

Change Ieaf256a5c0f54804686318d6cbd5877a5003c9eb made the powervm driver
plug_vifs method raise NotImplementedError rather than pass, which is
what the hyper-v and vmware drivers do for plug_vifs. This results in
the compute manager failing to init the host because it's not catching
NotImplementedError from driver.plug_vifs.

This patch simply changes the powervm driver plug_vifs method back to
the old behavior (pass), but at least logs a debug message this time.

Closes-Bug: #1217586

Change-Id: Iafe87cbb9b3cf728a47cb9cc43151798fcbb780f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
powervm: revert driver to pass for plug_vifs

Change Ieaf256a5c0f54804686318d6cbd5877a5003c9eb made the powervm driver
plug_vifs method raise NotImplementedError rather than pass, which is
what the hyper-v and vmware drivers do for plug_vifs. This results in
the compute manager failing to init the host because it's not catching
NotImplementedError from driver.plug_vifs.

This patch simply changes the powervm driver plug_vifs method back to
the old behavior (pass), but at least logs a debug message this time.

Closes-Bug: #1217586

Change-Id: Iafe87cbb9b3cf728a47cb9cc43151798fcbb780f

commit_message:
Make HostManager singleton

Currently there is no mechanism to maintain/synchronize more then 1
HostManager(HostState) in the system.
In order to support multiple active schedulers this class has to be a
singleton, this way each scheduler instance will hold a reference to the
same HostManager.

Required for implementation of blueprint multiple-scheduler-drivers.

Change-Id: I7d7d24d8e716ae9db16e4951b202614ebfdd7d8c

commit_message:
Implements APIs for VMDK driver

- Implemented APIs: create_volume, delete_volume, initialize_connection,
  create_snapthot, delete_snapshot, create_volume_from_snapshot,
  create_cloned_volume
- Modified etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample adding details for the driver
- Added suds dependency in requirements.txt
- create_volume: does no work. Volume's backing is created lazily
- delete_volume: delete backing if present
- initialize_connection: if backing, not present, create backing, else
  provide backing details to nova to perform attach
  Nova BP/vmware-nova-cinder-support
- create_snapshot: Creates the snapshot of the backing
- delete_snapshot: Deletes the snapshot of the backing
- create_volume_from_snapshot: Creates a full/linked clone from the snapshot
  point in VC. In ESX, copies the VM backing files, registers and reverts to
  the appropriate snapshot point.
- create_cloned_volume: Creates a full/linked clone in VC. In ESX, copies the
  VM backing files and registers as a new backing.
- Written appropriate unit tests
- Work item in BP/vmware-vmdk-cinder-driver

Implements: blueprint vmware-vmdk-cinder-driver
Change-Id: Ib11f2878f8f656209d1ba5e2cbfadae1ac1999b4

commit_message:
Add missing LH SAN driver features for Havana

The LeftHand driver did not support snapshot or extend volume.
The following features are part of the minimum driver features
that should be implemented in every cinder driver. This patch
adds the following missing features;
create snapshot
delete snapshot
create volume from snapshot
extend volume
It also fixes the DocStrings in the unit test so they pass the
checks.

Change-Id: Icda790fcddf4ea11782a8d6ec57b1e8f871eb167
Fixes: bug 1217118

commit_message:
Fix wrong UniqueConstraint name

Table `sourseassoc` has a conflicted with
OpenStack naming convention UniqueConstraint name.
Each UniqueConstraint should be named as
`uniq_table_name0column_first0column_second`.

bp: ceilometer-db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: Ic35a9351add9dd3ce014c938505e268e131112e8

commit_message:
Clean up metadata refresh unit test

The stack was not being fully created, because the calls to the mock
functions were not present for the second instance.

Fixes bug #1217829

commit_message:
Sync Transifex config with the source lang change in Transifex

Closes-Bug: #1179526

source_lang mismatch between Horizon and OpenStack Hub projects
has been addressed and the soruce language is changed from en_US
to en. This commit updates .tx/config to catch up it.

Also adds an entry for djangojs.po translation which was added
to Transifex recently.

Change-Id: I9a574b92a8396d2fda493d8dfa1261ddccc4ad02

commit_message:
Extra indexes cleanup

After all migrations database state has a difference with model state
in each dialect.

There is difference in models with database in indexes.
For some dialects indexes is skipped and for other extra indexes declared.

Dropped unique index:
- `source.id` for mysql.

Created index:
- `resource_user_id_project_id_key` for mysql and sqlite.

bp: ceilometer-db-sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I1fbb6dcdf6c3c21075caeef5241f09122d5e34c1

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-19 08:20:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add pagination parameter to the base class of stroage

Put all parameters for pagination into class named pagination,
add this paramter to the interface of the database driver.
For now, the methods support pagination query include
get_resources, get_meters, get_alarms.

Pagination parameter includes the following members:
1) 'limit': maximum number of items to return.
2) 'marker_pair': attribute-value pair to identify the last
    item of the previous page.
3) 'sort_keys': array of attributes by which results
    should be sorted.
4) 'sort_dirs': per-column array of sort_dirs,
    corresponding to sort_keys.

It is part of bp/paginate-db-search.

Implements blueprint paginate-db-search

commit_message:
Add pagination parameter to the database backends of storage

Put all parameters for pagination into class named pagination,
add this paramter to the interface of the database driver.
For now, the methods support pagination query include
get_resources, get_meters, get_alarms.
For get_samples function, because it has parameter limit now,
which should be include in pagination class, it is hard to
add the pagination query in this patch(it involves API codes).
We will add that in another patch.

Pagination parameter includes the following members:
1) 'limit': maximum number of items to return.
2) 'primary_sort_dir': sort direction of primary key.
2) 'marker_value': value of the primary key to identify the last
    item of the previous page.
3) 'sort_keys': array of attributes user pass in except the primary key.
4) 'sort_dirs': per-column array of sort_dirs, corresponding to sort_keys.

We update the prototype of sqlalchemy, hbase, mongodb
db2 and logging storage backend.
Pagination query for mongodb is merged already, we need to
reverse it first.

It is part of bp/paginate-db-search.

Implements blueprint paginate-db-search

Change-Id: I6eedcd728427f4ab20f575aa10675822301fd472

commit_message:
Configure the ec2 credentials explicitly in tempest

There is fall back logic in tempest to get the credentials himself,
when it is missing, but it causes additional start up time.

It is annoying on test case development.

Long time ago it happened at setup_package() time, but now tempest
does not uses this function.

Change-Id: Ic44bfb727ac6aa3fa2596a68aca0b562a67ea91a

subject: Make test_version_flag handle package distributions
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-22 14:28:35.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/cli/simple_read_only/test_compute_manage.py'], 'message': 'Make test_version_flag handle package distributions

The test_version_flag test case assumes that "nova-manage --version"
will equal "nova-manage version" which may be the case with devstack but
is not necessarily the case when using a different distribution, like
RPMs with CentOS or RHEL.  The test case should just make sure that
"nova-manage --version" is a subset of "nova-manage version".

For example:

[root@ip9-12-17-44 ~]# nova-manage version
2013.2-201308212212.el6
[root@ip9-12-17-44 ~]# nova-manage --version
2013.2

Closes-Bug: #1214781

Change-Id: I07298b6398c79322fca8b349d026a1c09ce4a77b
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make test_version_flag handle package distributions

The test_version_flag test case assumes that "nova-manage --version"
will equal "nova-manage version" which may be the case with devstack but
is not necessarily the case when using a different distribution, like
RPMs with CentOS or RHEL.  The test case should just make sure that
"nova-manage --version" is a subset of "nova-manage version".

For example:

[root@ip9-12-17-44 ~]# nova-manage version
2013.2-201308212212.el6
[root@ip9-12-17-44 ~]# nova-manage --version
2013.2

Closes-Bug: #1214781

Change-Id: I07298b6398c79322fca8b349d026a1c09ce4a77b

commit_message:
Add a RPC API to get a guest info from hypervisor

If libvirt is used, using this RPC API to get the xml describtion
of an instance from the libvirtd hosts the instance. Instead of the
source host CPU, comparing the instance CPU with destination host
CPU by using the xml describtion.

Return the exact reason in admin_actions API if the instance CPU
is incompatible with the dest host CPU.

Fixes bug #1082414

Co-authored-by: Takashi Natsume <natsume.takashi@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: I65f505fec64c65d2641d2bfd940cde44bcd83a77

Add support for local XenAPI connection

to be a recognisable string
Running as a local XenAPI connection also means we have to
treat the networking differently

commit_message:
Avoid using GREENDNS due to dnspython

If dnspython is present in your environment then
eventlet monkeypatches socket.getaddrinfo() with an implementation
which doesn't work for IPv6. To turn this off you need to set an
environment variable before you do the import.

Resolves bug 1164822

Change-Id: I4aa3d40d0f8d0f125c3a89c4ba062ad0d13f1c55

commit_message:
Updates Keystone Token Support

Previously, Grizzly used the [signing] section of keystone.conf
to manage the format [UUID|PKI] of auth tokens.

In Havana, the [signing] section of keystone.conf has been
deprecated in favor of provider in the [token] section:

  https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/etc/keystone.conf.sample#L170-L173

The token_format parameter has been replaced by the token_provider
parameter, which defaults to keystone.token.providers.pki.Provider
for backwards compatibility and to use PKI-based tokens.

Change-Id: Ie3a82a8e26c5504314fdaf16224741e936192aab

This change is to demonstrate a possible new naming scheme
for native OpenStack resource types. It implements a strawman
naming scheme and provides global environment registry mappings
so that any template using an old name should continue to work
indefinitely.

The justification for this scheme is as follows:
1. All lower case, as this is easier to type and easier to read
   for non-native english readers
2. Top level namespace is 'os' for OpenStack
3. Second level namespace should be taken from the keystone catalog
   service name (compute, network, volume, object-store, orchestration)
4. Resource type name should be taken from the noun used in the equivalent
   command-line client command (where possible)
5. Due to 3. and 4. a hyphen is used to separate words
   (object-store, router-gateway)
6. Resources internal to heat are in the os::orchestration namespace
   and get a name which complies with the above conventions

Change-Id: Ib5f70eb00dddfb1cdcc5c8ac9fb68da86cc5eee7
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename all OS:: resource types with registry mapping

This change is to demonstrate a possible new naming scheme
for native OpenStack resource types. It implements a strawman
naming scheme and provides global environment registry mappings
so that any template using an old name should continue to work
indefinitely.

The justification for this scheme is as follows:
1. All lower case, as this is easier to type and easier to read
   for non-native english readers
2. Top level namespace is 'os' for OpenStack
3. Second level namespace should be taken from the keystone catalog
   service name (compute, network, volume, object-store, orchestration)
4. Resource type name should be taken from the noun used in the equivalent
   command-line client command (where possible)
5. Due to 3. and 4. a hyphen is used to separate words
   (object-store, router-gateway)
6. Resources internal to heat are in the os::orchestration namespace
   and get a name which complies with the above conventions

Change-Id: Ib5f70eb00dddfb1cdcc5c8ac9fb68da86cc5eee7

subject: Makes client always use provided endpoint_url
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-30 04:46:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/client.py', 'tests/unit/test_auth.py'], 'message': "Makes client always use provided endpoint_url

When nova uses neutron-client and the client needs to authenticate with
identity it will additionally retrieve the service-catalog. The client will
then ignore the provided endpoint_url parameter given to it during
instantiation because the service-catalog retrieval process overrides that
parameter.

Using the endpoint declared in the service-catalog even though the endpoint is
given is unexpected given the precedent set by glance-client to respect that
parameter. Ensuring the parameter is used will allow users to override the
identity's catalog. This is useful if identity is in error, or if the user is
using a special development configuration.

Unit tests are included to test that said functionality occurs.

Fixes: bug #1212812
Change-Id: I743b27f92adbf251b2fe4aeba92befd9be5d460a
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Makes client always use provided endpoint_url

When nova uses neutron-client and the client needs to authenticate with
identity it will additionally retrieve the service-catalog. The client will
then ignore the provided endpoint_url parameter given to it during
instantiation because the service-catalog retrieval process overrides that
parameter.

Using the endpoint declared in the service-catalog even though the endpoint is
given is unexpected given the precedent set by glance-client to respect that
parameter. Ensuring the parameter is used will allow users to override the
identity's catalog. This is useful if identity is in error, or if the user is
using a special development configuration.

Unit tests are included to test that said functionality occurs.

Fixes: bug #1212812
Change-Id: I743b27f92adbf251b2fe4aeba92befd9be5d460a

Closes-Bug: #1218338
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Load tables of service plugins when migration auto generation

When we run "neutron-db-manage revision --autogenerate", it detects
table deletion of service plugins even when they are configured.
We need to load tables of service plugins to teach alembic such
tables exist.

Change-Id: I9186d36496069c8253683bd200326b80a6565fa6
Closes-Bug: #1218338

commit_message:
python3: Use from future import unicode_literals

use  "from future import unicode_literals" instead of u""

To the road to Python3, a possible next step would be to use the from __future__ import unicode_literals
and remove the u'' prefixes, as it is not supported in Python3.

Change-Id: Ic7afb3cf2d8dfad47b8a1626ab264f6d4f50d00e
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 0.7

Fixed H102 errors

Hacking 0.6 already pins down pep8, pyflakes and flake8 so they can be
removed from test-requirements as they are indirect dependencies.

Co-author: Joe Gordon <joe.gordon0@gmail.com>

Change-Id: If7e79c70fe44d7e42a14cd6c710fd9986f995446

subject: Sync py3kcompat from oslo-incubator
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-23 15:25:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/openstack/common/py3kcompat/urlutils.py', 'keystoneclient/openstack/common/py3kcompat/__init__.py', 'openstack-common.conf'], 'message': 'Sync py3kcompat from oslo-incubator

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several
functions to different modules and combined modules. Six
provides a consistent interface to the module through
six.moves

However urllib/urlparse is not covered by six.moves so
py3kcompat adds python2/python3 compatibility layer for
urllib/urlparse.

Change-Id: I98d45a84e8c2dcd965a9e5cc08d7bb341eb08bfc
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Sync py3kcompat from oslo-incubator

Python3 reorganized the standard library and moved several
functions to different modules and combined modules. Six
provides a consistent interface to the module through
six.moves

However urllib/urlparse is not covered by six.moves so
py3kcompat adds python2/python3 compatibility layer for
urllib/urlparse.

Change-Id: I98d45a84e8c2dcd965a9e5cc08d7bb341eb08bfc
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

[{'created': '2013-08-19 03:27:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/api.py'], 'message': 'let cinder to remove block in error_deleting state

This commit allows cinder to remove a block which is an error_deleting
state.  Without this check, cinder can end up in a bad state in which
there is a block with an error, but no new block can be created since
the old one cannot be deleted.

Change-Id: I790399c5591dab2b3881c95fd19ad087c56502c0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
let cinder to remove block in error_deleting state

This commit allows cinder to remove a block which is an error_deleting
state.  Without this check, cinder can end up in a bad state in which
there is a block with an error, but no new block can be created since
the old one cannot be deleted.

Change-Id: I790399c5591dab2b3881c95fd19ad087c56502c0

in order to support some of the arguments (e.g. snapshots).

Use OSLO jsonutils instead of json module

For most things there is very little difference, but as we have a
jsonutils module we should probably be using it.

Change-Id: I406ea81bb56ad90cc9ff9b8b58b0d35b694dc802

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6456, 'name': 'Sahdev Zala', 'email': 'spzala@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'spzala'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7708, 'name': 'Sergey Vilgelm', 'username': 'svilgelm', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-12 20:26:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix role lookup for Active Directory

When using Keystone against an Active Directory server, assigned
roles weren't found for users.

When roles are added as DNs in the roleOccupant attribute, an LDAP
server can normalize the value so that when the entry is read later
the roleOccupant isn't exactly the same as it was when added.
Keystone needs to compare DNs properly by normalizing them.

Keystone's fake LDAP is changed to muck with roleOccupant DNs by
uppercasing attribute names (like Active Directory). The code is
fixed to correctly get the roles for users even with the modified
DNs.

Change-Id: Iaa41c3ef9febcabef0662f38b13d319a5b5583bc
Resolves-Bug: #1210675
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-08-12 20:39:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix role lookup for Active Directory

roles weren't found for users.

When roles are added as DNs in the roleOccupant attribute, an LDAP
server can normalize the value so that when the entry is read later
the roleOccupant isn't exactly the same as it was when added.
Keystone needs to compare DNs properly by normalizing them.

Keystone's fake LDAP is changed to muck with roleOccupant and
member DNs by uppercasing attribute names (like Active Directory).
The code is fixed to correctly get the roles for users with the

", 'number': 5}, {'created': '2013-08-23 22:06:48.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/ldap/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/assignment/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': "Fix role lookup for Active Directory

When using Keystone against an Active Directory server, assigned
roles weren't found for users.

When roles are added as DNs in the roleOccupant attribute, an LDAP
server can normalize the value so that when the entry is read later
the roleOccupant isn't exactly the same as it was when added.
Keystone should compare users by ID rather than by DN.
(Note that this is how the comparison is done in Grizzly.)

Keystone's fake LDAP is changed to muck with roleOccupant and
member DNs by uppercasing attribute names (like Active Directory).
The code is fixed to compare users by ID rather than DN.

commit_message:
Fix role lookup for Active Directory

When using Keystone against an Active Directory server, assigned
roles weren't found for users.

When roles are added as DNs in the roleOccupant attribute, an LDAP
server can normalize the value so that when the entry is read later
the roleOccupant isn't exactly the same as it was when added.
Keystone should compare users by ID rather than by DN.
(Note that this is how the comparison is done in Grizzly.)

Keystone's fake LDAP is changed to muck with roleOccupant and
member DNs by uppercasing attribute names (like Active Directory).
The code is fixed to compare users by ID rather than DN.

Change-Id: Iaa41c3ef9febcabef0662f38b13d319a5b5583bc
Resolves-Bug: #1210675

commit_message:
Support for NVP distributed router

Blueprint nvp-distributed-router

This patch adds support for NVP distributed logical routers
adding a simple attribute extension.
The default router type can be controlled used the default_router_type
option in the nvp section of neutron configuration.
In order to ensure backward compatibility, pre-existing routers
will be treated as centralized routers.

Change-Id: Iaab9ffb6071c93990be711ebb56c212230544a7a

The DiskFile constructor needs to grow a bit in the future it is was

commit_message:
Refactor DiskFile init logic into multiple methods

The DiskFile constructor needs to grow a bit in the future it is was
already considered "large" by some. This breaks the logic up into
three main parts:

  1. Determine if the object exists, fetching the on-disk file(s) to
     use
  2. Finish the object construction when we have a tombstone file
  3. Finish the object construction when we have a regular data file,
     and optionally a fast-POST metadata file

We added a number of assertions as a way of documenting the expected
behavior of the loop that figures out the on-disk file to use, and a
set of unit tests to verify the loop works as expected.

Change-Id: I1503b7561e280ded3222a09514edc59ac26dbc65
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

a command to allow overrides in the horizon directory,

Adds Hyper-V compute inspector

Blueprint: hyper-v-agent

Adds a compute inspector for Hyper-V. Supports Windows Server / Hyper-V
Server 2012 and above.

Disk stats are supported starting with Hyper-V 2012 R2.

Change-Id: Ib6499b631a2f7e406198b13f4b5788a3b880fb1b

commit_message:
powervm: Use FixedIntervalLoopingCall for polling LPAR status

This patch moves the code in stop_lpar that polls the LPAR status for
'Not Activated' to it's own helper method that uses
FixedIntervalLoopingCall with an eventlet timeout.

Also moves the hard-coded timeout to the constants file.

Builds on top of change Iad64dda79f46d18c7aa5bee12ed41e7a01853d34 to
verify the new looping call and timeout code works with the
test_stop_lpar_timeout test case in that patch.

Change-Id: I59586d3cb242d40ee5e09e48274de11cb5638717

commit_message:
Add project CRUD to assignment_api Manager

Specifically, the "proxy" methods on identity_api for following methods
are removed in favor of assignment_api:

- create_project
- update_project
- delete_project

The majority of this change is a refactor in support of the incomplete
work done for bp split-identity in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/33745/

Notification decorators are also added to these 3 methods in support of
bp notifications and bug 967832.

Change-Id: I81b4eca720615b38a38858aecd734af8ab383d91

commit_message:
Add kwargs to create_volume in tests/utils.py

Add availability_zone parameter and kwargs to make create_volume
function more flexible in order to use this function in
unit tests.
The goal is to remove inner _create_volume function in:
- db/test_transfers.py
- api/contrib/test_backups.py
- test_gpfs.py
- test_volume_transfer.py
- test_volume.py
and to use create_volume from tests/utils instead.

Change-Id: I2d9456ff3ff1cd945042f19c47e40f9f0ec0fe8a

commit_message:
Add NFS/GlusterFS support to brick library

Refactor NFS driver to use the brick library to perform mounts
rather than duplicating the mount code. Some of the NFS unit
test code was rewritten to test the brick implementation because
the old mount code was moved.

The Gluster driver was slightly affected in the refactoring, but
does not yet use brick to perform attaches.

bug 1214748

Change-Id: Ib29f83fabe407f9591191e9fd19e6306ca9960cf

commit_message:
Remove unused methods from cinder.utils

These methods and class  were left over from the split from Nova and are unused still.

Remove methods:
	debug()
	utf8()
	map_dict_keys()
	check_isinstance()
	timefunc()
	logging_error()
	temporary_mutation()
	generate_mac_address()

Remove class:
	UndoManager

Change-Id: Id3a94ff9066627b5c0efef068f8c569423f1e9d8

commit_message:
Add Memory Isolating Cache Proxy

Created a specialized dogpile.cache proxy to isolate in-memory data in the
cache region from modificaiton during tests using liberal application of
copy.deepcopy for get/set operations.

partial-blueprint: caching-layer-for-driver-calls
Change-Id: Id6d27219b75ea7e6709d220542dd31c4a6c7aa04

commit_message:
Add delay in swift-bench

With enable write affinity, it's necessary to wait until
replication has moved things to their proper homes before
running delete request. With write affinity turned on, only
nodes in local region will get the object right after PUT request.

Fix bug #1198926

Change-Id: I3aa8933d45c47a010ae05561e12176479e7c9bcc

commit_message:
PCI device auto discover

Hypervisor discovers and returns information about assignable PCI devices
as xml resource. PCI auto discover provoid method to convert these to a
dict. PCI tracker will transform the information into pci device object
store it into the DataBase.

bp:pci-passthrough-base

Change-Id: I6241053668a430f573d23dc862d812259c004dfd
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

subject: Add PCI device filters support

based on vendor_id or device_id etc.

commit_message:
Add PCI device filters support

Cloud administrator may decide the devices that can be assigned to VM
based on vendor_id or device_id etc.

This is whitelist based filter. No device will be assigned
except explicitly defined.

The configuration option 'pci_passthrough_whitelist' can be defined multi
times, each for one type of device.

bp:pci-passthrough-base

Change-Id: I03f2a0c098198a32abedff0773e9f94e3d7d2f28
Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Yongli He <yongli.he@intel.com>

commit_message:
Forbid update of subnet gateway ip when in use by a port

Bug 1186322

If a port is currently using the subnet's gateway IP, which usually
happens for router interfaces, do not allow updates to the gateway IP.
This patch adds an extra query on the IPAllocation model, which
returns at most a single record, and is executed in _validate_subnet
only when the subnet is updated.

Change-Id: Ie29be1b83f9a639562bfc84f3f2c082833126d32

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-06 17:26:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Improve dhcp agent structure to support multiple dhcp models

This patch introduces some minor refactoring of the dhcp
code so that it is easy to support both an in-node/same
process dhcp provisioning model (e.g. with dnsmasq) and
proxy model, where DHCP is provided by an external node.

Higher separation of concerns is also achieved by doing
better data encapsulation.

Implements blueprint dhcp-flexi-model

Change-Id: Icbd215e9682ecaebb6a4300423f3564e8e677566

commit_message:
Improve dhcp agent structure to support multiple dhcp models

This patch introduces some minor refactoring of the dhcp
code so that it is easy to support both an in-node/same
process dhcp provisioning model (e.g. with dnsmasq) and
proxy model, where DHCP is provided by an external node.

Higher separation of concerns is also achieved by doing
better data encapsulation.

Implements blueprint dhcp-flexi-model

Change-Id: Icbd215e9682ecaebb6a4300423f3564e8e677566
